attributes.action: Government to resign and call election. Major parties to stand on pro EU agenda
attributes.additional_details: Whilst William Healy's petition calling for a second referendum is admirable, despite gaining over 4M signatures, there appears to be no legal basis for going down this route and only a general election could lead to a proper mandate to ignore the referendum result. We call on Tory, Labour, Lib Dem and the SNP parliamentarians to support a pro European stance.
attributes.background: The result of the EU referendum exposes the UK to financial risks that will impact every citizen. It may also lead to a greatly destabalized Europe with the prospect of a rise in far right and left politics that could put an end to the peace that Europe has enjoyed for many decades.

rejection.details:
The House of Commons is able to trigger an early General Election if criteria set out in the Fixed-term Parliaments Act 2011 are met.

The following petition calls for an early General Election in the wake of the EU referendum result:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/133548
